🌧️ There are still numerous #FloodAlerts and #FloodWarnings in place around the county. 

🌧️ For the latest flood alerts and warnings in #Lancashire see: https://t.co/Ir753b4po5.

🌧️ Follow @EnvAgencyNW and @TheFloodHub for updates. #LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/T4As6J0IkQ

We’re currently supporting our colleagues from @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire and @EnvAgencyNW, evacuating a number of residents from Hayhurst Marina due to the flooding cause by #StormChristoph. #StaySafe https://t.co/VqH0A1WD5h

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph has led to high river levels across the country. Stay safe at home – if you do need to head out, don’t take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/NoJbBteLiZ

tweets.text: @MasterFiddler @EnvAgencyMids Hi Stephen, sorry I’ve been tied up with the issues on the Derwent today. I will have a look at the flow graphs later.

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been out at Croston pumping station this afternoon.

Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/rTwvpdKuwB

B4195 Stourport Road #Bewdley is now CLOSED between Beale's Corner & Westbourne Street for flood barrier installation 

Bewdley bridge closing to vehicular traffic at 7pm for approx 4 hours https://t.co/OWZgqOxTvy

tweets.text: @WorcsTravel @worcscc @MalvernHills_DC @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA Is hanley road open?

@CleanerDartford @Dartford_CA @guardianeco @TheSun @KentMessenger @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySE why are we #recycling ♻️ again? #counciltax #ClimateChange  #environnement #flytipping @TheRingleyGroup https://t.co/eUFO1MZogU

tweets.text: Another one in! Surface velocity radar gauge installed on the River Mardle in Buckfastleigh. This will enable @EnvAgencySW to issue flood warnings to the local community, and to assess the effectiveness of #naturalfloodmanagement measures upstream. Good work everyone! https://t.co/Q0cJj1V6m6
⚠️ New Street #Upton will be closing later this afternoon https://t.co/fCHe3Km3Ij

We are experiencing issues with the forecast model data displayed on our https://t.co/u5YnaL7y4i page along the #RiverSevern in #Shropshire. The correct forecast levels for #WelshBridge in #Shrewsbury are 4.1m to 4.5m which is more in line with normal winter flooding levels.

It comes after I asked councils and the @EnvAgency at the end of last year how prepared we were if flooding struck again during the pandemic.

They all said yes.

Storm Christoph could be about to put that to the test.

https://t.co/aNkUCBF8gU

urls.title: Charlotte Cross: Are we prepared for flooding in Covid times? | ITV News
urls.description: With the added challenge of a global pandemic, Environment Correspondent Charlotte Cross looks at how we're placed if we have another winter as wet as the last.

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
A flood warning has been issued by @EnvAgencyYNE for Brearley and Luddenden Foot.

River levels across the Upper Calder Catchment have risen as a result of this afternoon's heavy rainfall. Levels are now approaching the threshold where properties are expected to flood ⚠️ https://t.co/ppoHS5gEpW

More heavy rain coming in next 24 hours. Remember: even when the weather calms, rivers continue to rise, so please check #FloodWarnings all week here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY It's a free service, updated every 15 mins. It could save your life. #PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgency https://t.co/swa11ANaVu

tweets.text: @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @K_Fletcher_MP Thanks all! I’ve never seen Bretherton as wet as this, hoping the new infrastructure does its job upstream and all are safe
Please use https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 to get the latest information. #FloodWarnings #Floodaware

Heavy showers can lead to surface water and river flooding in some communities. Here at #Didsbury, you can see how high water levels are. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn
 
#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/G3YpFLjgnu

tweets.text:
We have received many requests for sandbags today. Priority is being given to the worst affected areas of the borough. 

Follow @EnvAgencyNW to keep up to date with the latest flood warnings and forecasts for your area: https://t.co/L0sbOoOadY
Fast flowing and rising River #Wharfe at Burley in #Wharfedale. @itvcalendar  @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/uzNiUxRhLe

❗ A flood warning has now been issued by the @EnvAgency for Ford Lane/Cheadle Wood following heavy rain (please see map below).
River levels are rising as a result of heavy rainfall associated with Storm Christoph. Flooding to properties in this area is expected
#stormchristoph https://t.co/6SzSGVe0uv

tweets.text: Take care out there across @peakdistrict. Don’t drive through flood water and check your flood risk in your area with @EnvAgency at https://t.co/68lkWODra0  @Derbyshirecc @derbyshiredales @SheffCouncil @KirkleesCouncil @HighPeakBC @StaffMoorlandDC https://t.co/iuonchjWHy

We currently have 17 #flood warnings and 40 #flood alerts in place across the #Yorkshire region.  For the latest details about the areas affected by #StormChristoph please visit the live national flood warning map at https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/SKf9a3ZAzl

It’s wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don’t drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

Last task of the day for our #Wey Field team ,the loading of barriers in preparation of any deployment in the coming days . The teams have been busy today visiting 192 locations to ensure blockages removed and all cameras working during #Stormchristophe .⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ https://t.co/WLKm86lxYQ

Falling river levels on the River Coquet in #Northumberland mean that the flood gates at #Rothbury have been re-opened. You can find out the water level in your local river by clicking here: https://t.co/Wx5K6zAf5z   #Floodaware

tweets.text:
@DobbyWoods @CRTContactUs Are we in the middle of responding to you, or are you saying you e-mailed us and you've heard nothing back? 

I don't know who you e-mailed, but you could call us, and it would be passed to the local team: 0800 807060. Thanks, Peter

🌧️ With #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts in place for parts of #Lancashire, watch our video for steps to stay safe before, during, and after a flood and see: https://t.co/8Oh91nEOml

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub for updates
#LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/jZHobb4Ds8

urls.title: Flooding - Lancashire County Council
urls.description: If there is an immediate risk to your life or you are trapped by flood water call 999.

tweets.text: On Monday we lifted the bridge from the top of the #Foss Barrier as part of our preparations to replace the Foss barrier gate. Due to high river levels, we've delayed the rest of the work until river levels have fallen. @CityofYork https://t.co/FUlGqSOym6

⚠️ The #FloodWarnings for the county include the River Irwell at #Rawtenstall: https://t.co/pENwvB0lB9. 

🌊 River levels are expected to remain high until Friday.

ℹ️  @EnvAgencyNW teams are closely monitoring weather forecasts and river levels. #LancsAlert #StormCristoph https://t.co/jtQFheT1F8

tweets.text:
So all that crap that washes off roads and into rivers polluting them, rubber, brake dust, oil, exhausts, petrol, diesel, etc.

Well appears the @EncAgency has the power to make ever Local Authority apply for a permit and put a stop to it. 

Guess what?

https://t.co/WrQ6I0DaJ8

⚠️ The county is covered by several @metoffice rain warnings today including a Amber warning for certain areas.

A risk of some rivers flooding as a result of today’s rainfall.

Keep up to date with the latest @EnvAgency River warnings here https://t.co/5xRmAfX37h https://t.co/OzKsPpA1Q0

tweets.text: @EnvAgency Rivers never dredged, councils never empty road side drains, housing developments built on flood plains! No wonder rivers struggle
#StormChristoph currently 2 @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings & 3 alerts in place for #Leeds. Keep updated and informed at https://t.co/FjsUnQcPZe #PrepareActSurvive

Update on situation in #Derbyshire latest #flood warning issued. Please keep checking your #flood risk
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/6hnNcFygJB

With flood warnings across the country caused by Storm Christoph, make sure you're prepared by following the @EnvAgency's Prepare, Act, Survive advice. 
#REACTDisasterResponse #floodwarning #StormChristoph
https://t.co/fenhxuNdk3 https://t.co/Byezk4tvo9

tweets.text: The UK is losing ~100 ha of saltmarsh each year, that is insane!!! 😱Great work from @EssexWT_Rachel et al to reverse this in Essex🌱Look forward to working on this in the Solent soon with @MountainCD @JPrestonDiggles @EnvAgency @hambleharbour and others #CoastalFutures21 https://t.co/Sb7RiPal6a

#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo

This image from #Bakewell shows us how the heavy rainfall brought by #StormChristoph is affecting #Derbyshire. Please keep checking your #flood risk. Latest information here https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/MJswbrAP1N

Heavy rain from #StormChristoph continues to fall across England, with many rivers at dangerously high levels. Stay safe at home. Check your flood risk and what to do in a flood at: https://t.co/V47W2jC8nk  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/p2kNAPufc3

tweets.text: Flow monitoring has just been installed on two of the rain planters @CarshaltonHigh. This will improve understanding of how the planters are storing and slowing down the flow of water to reduce flood risk, and allow us to improve our future designs. #SuDSnotFloods @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/eE0EVxI3Cn
@ScottishEPA proud to be working with partner agencies across the #UK to tackle the blight of #WasteCrime. @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @JenAS2002 https://t.co/ZwidvGUI3W

We have 14 #flood warnings in place across Greater Manchester and Cheshire this afternoon. This means flooding is expected and immediate action is required

Check your risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/r0eYwgfghj https://t.co/JDTUFhoa1j

Rather soggy on the @TPT_National @sustrans near Simons Bridge in Didsbury - river level is very very close to top of levees and is at a record level at Northenden measuring station @EnvAgencyNW ☹️ https://t.co/ThB1gFkJfo

My latest stop today was at #Croston #Lancashire where I found Amber & Lynn from @EnvAgencyNW field teams overseeing the operation of our #flood storage basin. #incidents #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Ap9yeq1xTW

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable And here's me about to do my response to the urea consultation.  No doubt the farmer will be bashing his hand on the table, demanding that the NFU saves all his fertiliser choices, what with him being such a world class professional who will spread the stuff ever so carefully.

Our ops team is in Retford #Notts again today deploying temporary pumps to help alleviate any #flooding issues. Please keep checking your #flood risk as more rain is forecasted across the #Midlands

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/rX56LqeWwe

tweets.text: Flood Alerts have been issued by @EnvAgency: https://t.co/aPJmbxM0lz for parts of West Sussex, with more likely in the coming days. Please take care of yourself, family & neighbours, especially if vulnerable. Please see the WSCC website for advice: https://t.co/liIY0WxFVw https://t.co/HduZntyVo6
The River Mersey at East Didsbury. This isn’t even peak level yet. @EnvAgencyNW  tell residents to sign up to flood alerts. #StormChristoph https://t.co/sTgYpfqKrE
Environment Agency staff are putting up the flood barriers in #Hereford this morning. Peak level of 5.5 metres possible on the River Wye at Old Bridge tomorrow. https://t.co/w3rTbEg5iA

As many areas of the country brace for possible flooding, today I wrote to the Prime Minister @BorisJohnson about the progress made on implementing flood defences, and emphasised that more can be done to prevent the devastation flooding brings. #RiverSevernPartnership @EnvAgency https://t.co/Gqt8p3wuGI

tweets.text: #Stormchristoph has brought persistent, heavy rain to Stockport today. More is due overnight. Drive safely - roads are liable to standing water. Make sure you are prepared at home too. For more information visit : https://t.co/0B3rNdnftb and follow @EnvAgencyNW @stockportmbc https://t.co/jjg2blMdbP
